name: Roo.dd.DDProxy
desc:
A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into
the document that follows the cursor during drag operations.  At the time of
the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html
element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.

References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that
was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the
page.

config.name: listeners

methods.name: initFrame
methods.desc:
Initialization for the drag frame element.  Must be called in the
constructor of all subclasses

methods.name: createFrame
methods.desc: Creates the proxy element if it does not yet exist

methods.name: alignElWithMouse
methods.desc:
Sets the element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

params.name: el
params.desc: the element to move

params.name: iPageX
params.desc: the X coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

params.name: iPageY
params.desc: the Y coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

methods.name: setDelta
methods.desc:
Sets the pointer offset.  You can call this directly to force the
offset to be in a particular location (e.g., pass in 0,0 to set it
to the center of the object)

params.name: iDeltaX
params.desc: the distance from the left

params.name: iDeltaY
params.desc: the distance from the top

methods.name: autoOffset
methods.desc:
Sets the pointer offset to the distance between the linked element's top
left corner and the location the element was clicked

params.name: iPageX
params.desc: the X coordinate of the click

params.name: iPageY
params.desc: the Y coordinate of the click

methods.name: setDragElPos
methods.desc:
Sets the drag element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

params.name: iPageX
params.desc: the X coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

params.name: iPageY
params.desc: the Y coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

methods.name: cachePosition
methods.desc:
Saves the most recent position so that we can reset the constraints and
tick marks on-demand.  We need to know this so that we can calculate the
number of pixels the element is offset from its original position.

params.name: iPageX
params.desc:
the current x position (optional, this just makes it so we
don't have to look it up again)

params.name: iPageY
params.desc:
the current y position (optional, this just makes it so we
don't have to look it up again)

methods.name: setHandleElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a child of the linked element that should be
used to initiate the drag operation.  An example of this would be if
you have a content div with text and links.  Clicking anywhere in the
content area would normally start the drag operation.  Use this method
to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element
that starts the drag operation.

params.name: id
params.desc:
{string} the id of the element that will be used to
initiate the drag.

methods.name: init
methods.desc:
Sets up the DragDrop object.  Must be called in the constructor of any
Roo.dd.DragDrop subclass

params.name: id
params.desc: the id of the linked element

params.name: sGroup
params.desc: the group of related items

params.name: config
params.desc: configuration attributes

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleType
methods.desc: Unsets an excluded tag name set by addInvalidHandleType

params.name: tagName
params.desc: the type of element to unexclude

methods.name: unreg
methods.desc: Remove all drag and drop hooks for this element

methods.name: addInvalidHandleType
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation
when clicked.  This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a
drag handle that do something other than start the drag.

params.name: tagName
params.desc: the type of element to exclude

methods.name: onDragDrop
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on another DragDrop
obj

params.name: e
params.desc: the mouseup event

params.name: id
params.desc:
In POINT mode, the element
id this was dropped on.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items this
was dropped on.

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleId
methods.desc: Unsets an invalid handle id

params.name: id
params.desc: the id of the element to re-enable

methods.name: onAvailable
methods.desc:
Override the onAvailable method to do what is needed after the initial
position was determined.

methods.name: setOuterHandleElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to set an element outside of the linked element as a drag
handle

params.name: id
params.desc: the id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag

methods.name: onMouseUp
methods.desc: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mouseup

params.name: e
params.desc: the mouseup event

methods.name: getDragEl
methods.desc:
Returns a reference to the actual element to drag.  By default this is
the same as the html element, but it can be assigned to another
element. An example of this can be found in Roo.dd.DDProxy

methods.name: setYConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Set
this to limit the vertical travel of the element.  Pass in 0,0 for the
parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.

params.name: iUp
params.desc: the number of pixels the element can move up

params.name: iDown
params.desc: the number of pixels the element can move down

params.name: iTickSize
params.desc:
optional parameter for specifying that the
element should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

methods.name: clearConstraints
methods.desc:
Clears any constraints applied to this instance.  Also clears ticks
since they can't exist independent of a constraint at this time.

methods.name: onInvalidDrop
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on an area with no
drop target

params.name: e
params.desc: the mouseup event

methods.name: addInvalidHandleId
methods.desc:
Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle
that should not initiate a drag

params.name: id
params.desc: the element id of the element you wish to ignore

methods.name: removeInvalidHandleClass
methods.desc: Unsets an invalid css class

params.name: cssClass
params.desc:
the class of the element(s) you wish to
re-enable

methods.name: onDragOut
methods.desc: Abstract method called when we are no longer hovering over an element

params.name: e
params.desc: the mousemove event

params.name: id
params.desc:
In POINT mode, the element
id this was hovering over.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items
that the mouse is no longer over.

methods.name: setDragElId
methods.desc:
Allows you to specify that an element other than the linked element
will be moved with the cursor during a drag

params.name: id
params.desc: {string} the id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag

methods.name: endDrag
methods.desc: Fired when we are done dragging the object

params.name: e
params.desc: the mouseup event

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns a reference to the linked element

methods.name: onDrag
methods.desc:
Abstract method called during the onMouseMove event while dragging an
object.

params.name: e
params.desc: the mousemove event

methods.name: onDragEnter
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this element fist begins hovering over
another DragDrop obj

params.name: e
params.desc: the mousemove event

params.name: id
params.desc:
In POINT mode, the element
id this is hovering over.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of one or more
dragdrop items being hovered over.

methods.name: lock
methods.desc: Lock this instance

methods.name: onMouseDown
methods.desc: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mousedown

params.name: e
params.desc: the mousedown event

methods.name: applyConfig
methods.desc:
Applies the configuration parameters that were passed into the constructor.
This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain.  So
a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and
DragDrop in order to get all of the parameters that are available in
each object.

methods.name: unlock
methods.desc: Unlock this instace

methods.name: isTarget
methods.desc:
By default, all insances can be a drop target.  This can be disabled by
setting isTarget to false.

methods.name: setInitPosition
methods.desc: Stores the initial placement of the linked element.

params.name: diffX
params.desc: the X offset, default 0

params.name: diffY
params.desc: the Y offset, default 0

methods.name: initTarget
methods.desc:
Initializes Targeting functionality only... the object does not
get a mousedown handler.

params.name: id
params.desc: the id of the linked element

params.name: sGroup
params.desc: the group of related items

params.name: config
params.desc: configuration attributes

methods.name: addToGroup
methods.desc:
Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects.  All
instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many
groups as needed.

params.name: sGroup
params.desc: {string} the name of the group

methods.name: onDragOver
methods.desc:
Abstract method called when this element is hovering over another
DragDrop obj

params.name: e
params.desc: the mousemove event

params.name: id
params.desc:
In POINT mode, the element
id this is hovering over.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items
being hovered over.

methods.name: toString
methods.desc: toString method

methods.name: setPadding
methods.desc:
Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands
(or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations.
Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom
will have the first param, the left and right the second.

params.name: iTop
params.desc: Top pad

params.name: iRight
params.desc: Right pad

params.name: iBot
params.desc: Bot pad

params.name: iLeft
params.desc: Left pad

methods.name: removeFromGroup
methods.desc: Remove's this instance from the supplied interaction group

params.name: sGroup
params.desc: The group to drop

methods.name: addInvalidHandleClass
methods.desc: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag

params.name: cssClass
params.desc: the class of the elements you wish to ignore

methods.name: startDrag
methods.desc:
Abstract method called after a drag/drop object is clicked
and the drag or mousedown time thresholds have beeen met.

params.name: X
params.desc: click location

params.name: Y
params.desc: click location

methods.name: padding
methods.desc:
The padding configured for this drag and drop object for calculating
the drop zone intersection with this object.

methods.name: resetConstraints
methods.desc: resetConstraints must be called if you manually reposition a dd element.

methods.name: clearTicks
methods.desc: Clears any tick interval defined for this instance

methods.name: isLocked
methods.desc:
Returns true if this instance is locked, or the drag drop mgr is locked
(meaning that all drag/drop is disabled on the page.)

methods.name: setXConstraint
methods.desc:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Use
this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element.  Pass in
0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.

params.name: iLeft
params.desc: the number of pixels the element can move to the left

params.name: iRight
params.desc:
the number of pixels the element can move to the
right

params.name: iTickSize
params.desc:
optional parameter for specifying that the
element
should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

methods.name: isValidHandleChild
methods.desc: Checks the tag exclusion list to see if this click should be ignored

params.name: node
params.desc: the HTMLElement to evaluate

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to release

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to capture

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
